intro: Crudia acuta, commonly known as the sharpleaf cudweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are sharply pointed and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and yellowish. Crudia acuta is often found in open habitats and is adapted to arid or semi-arid conditions.
